definition: easy to learn
study of the Book of Changes 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1]
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology

sentences.english: Part six deals with the appraisal of Yang Wanli's Yi-ology.
sentences.chinese: 第六部分是對楊萬里易學思想的評價。

sentences.english: This method has the advantages of simplicity, accuracy and is easy to generalize.
sentences.chinese: 該法簡便易學，恢速準確，容易推廣。

sentences.english: What sport can learn and easy to understand, ages beneficial to everyone?
sentences.chinese: 什麼體育項目能易學易懂，老少皆宜對大家都有益？

sentences.english: This coin trick is easy to learn.
sentences.chinese: 這個硬幣魔術簡單易學。

sentences.english: Which phonemic symbols are easiest to learn?
It is easy to swim if another holds up your head.
sentences.chinese: 有人扶着頭，容易學游泳。

sentences.english: "National examination system to learn by teaching" expert members of the first series of the pipeline.
sentences.chinese: 《全國易學考試統用教材》第一輯的編審專家委員。

sentences.english: Our teacher said that gardening is enjoyable, and easy to learn.
sentences.chinese: 老師說園藝學是令人愉快的，而且簡單易學。

sentences.english: It's very easy to learn and operate the system with online help subsystem.
sentences.chinese: 本系統操作方便，易學易用，並配有強大的聯機幫助。

sentences.english: English is a language easy to learn but difficult to master.
sentences.chinese: 英語是一門容易學但是難精通的語言。

sentences.english: It has a high place in Yi learning of Song dynasty and has a remarkable impact on later generations.
sentences.chinese: 在宋代易學史上佔有一定地位，對後世產生重要影響。

sentences.english: Breathing exercises are easy to learn.
On the other hand PHP has always been considered a language with few features that was easy to learn.
sentences.chinese: 而另一方面PHP一直被認爲易學的功能較少。

sentences.english: That's it. High learnability, with this few concepts.
sentences.chinese: 這些概念都是高度易學的。

sentences.english: I think English is easier than science.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲英語比理科容易學。
每個字母將代表安易學。

definition: Chinese national culture/studies of ancient Chinese civilization/the Imperial College (history)
Wei and Jin philosophical school amalgamating Daoist and Confucian ideals/translation of metaphysics (also translated 形而上學|形而上学)
The Book of Changes ("I Ching")
scholar/learned person
sinology/Chinese studies (in foreign schools)/Han Learning, a Qing dynasty movement aiming at a philological appraisal of the Classics
to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
research area/field of research
to study/to practice
paleography
linguistics
learning/science/academic/CL:個|个[ge4]
to read aloud/to recite rhythmically/to chant/to intone (esp. poems in rhythm)
ancient Chinese divination tradition (still in use today)
passed on from generation to generation (idiom); to hand down
to blend/to integrate/to amalgamate/to fuse
lit. to have accumulated knowledge and deliver it slowly (idiom)/good preparation is the key to success/to be well prepared
